Create a spatial distribution report.

Creates an HTML report showing the location and nearest-neighbor relations of cells in a single field and two chosen phenotypes.

spatial_distribution_report(cell_seg_path, phenotypes, colors,
  output_path = NULL, pixels_per_micron = 2, plot_gx_max = 100,
  micron_line = 25)

Arguments

cell_seg_path

Path to a cell seg data file.
phenotypes

A character vector containing two phenotype names.
colors

A character vector of two color specifications.
output_path

Optional, path to the output HTML file. If omitted, output will be written to the directory containing cell_seg_path.
pixels_per_micron

Conversion factor to microns (default 2 pixels/micron),
plot_gx_max

Optional, maximum value of radius to show on G function plots.
micron_line

Optional, X location (radius in microns) of crosshair on G function plots.

Details

A cell seg data file for the field is required. If a tissue segmentation or composite image of the field is available, it will be used as a background.

The report is saved to the same directory as the input file.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
cell_seg_path = system.file("extdata", "TMA",
                       "Core[1,5,6,1]_[21302,15107]_cell_seg_data.txt",
                       package = "informr")

phenotypes = c("macrophage CD68", "cytotoxic CD8")
colors = c('red', 'blue')
out_path = path.expand('~/spatial_distribution_report.html')

spatial_distribution_report(cell_seg_path, phenotypes, colors, out_path)
# }
